intro: Tryphostemma heterophyllum, commonly known as the variable leaf balsam, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its diverse leaf morphology, which can vary significantly between individuals. The plant produces showy, colorful flowers that are typically borne on erect stems. Its leaves are often alternate and can be simple or lobed, depending on environmental conditions. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded habitats.
